data: Lady Markham received young Gaunt with the most gracious kindness: had his mother seen him seated in the drawing-room at Eaton Square, with Frances hovering about him full of pleasure and questions, and her mother insisting that he should stay to luncheon, and Markhamâ€™s hansom just drawing up at the door, she would have thought her boy on the highway to fortune.
A House Divided Against Itself; vol. 3 of 3
